intro: Conophytum hirtum var. baradii, commonly known as the Baradii conophytum, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, fleshy leaves that form a rosette shape. The leaves are typically covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a fuzzy appearance. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. This species is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water to thrive.
